.
Requirements for an Alternate Signer
38 U.S.C. 5101
requires an
alternate signer
be at least one of the following:
a court-appointed representative
an individual responsible for the care of the claimant or beneficiary, including a spouse or other relative
an attorney-in-fact or agent authorized to act on behalf of the claimant or beneficiary under a durable POA, or
a manager or principal officer acting on behalf of an institution caring for the claimant or beneficiary.
Note
:  When the evidence of record includes documentation reflecting that a court or VA finding has been made concerning the claimant’s competency status, accept a signature of any of the following on behalf of a claimant without following the procedures for alternate signers:
a court appointed guardian
a court appointed fiduciary (with an associated finding of incompetency), or
a VA appointed fiduciary.
Reference
:  For more information reviewing documents pertaining to a claimant’s competency status, see
38 CFR 3.353
, and
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 6.A
and
D
.
